newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa Reserve Bank confirms it defended rand.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa Reserve Bank confirms it defended rand.

text.p: The South African Reserve Bank on Tuesday confirmed it had sold dollars in the local currency market to stabilise the rand after it fell sharply against the dollar.
"We were in the market to stabilise the exchange rate when it reacted very sharply," Reserve Bank general manager of international banking Bertus van Zyl told Reuters.

Earlier the rand sank almost seven cents from its day's strongest level of 4.3790 bid against the dollar following central bank governor Chris Stals' comments that the rand's recent rally could be a slight over-adjustment.
Van Zyl added that the Bank had been in the market at around the 4.45 level. The currency touched a day's weakest level of 4.4530 against the dollar at 1204 GMT.
